resources.string: This app is primarily targeted at Texas parents. Many of the resources provided are applicable to areas outside Texas, but some are specifically relevant to Texas. Please keep this in mind.
All copyrights belong to their respective owners.\nProgramed by Eli Weiss for Children at Risk.
CHILDREN AT RISK serves as a catalyst for change to improve the quality of life for children through research, policy analysis, education, collaboration, and advocacy.
No-Cost Meals for\n Kids in Houston
Health information and resources for immigrant families.
A collection of CDC suggested health resources for parents
Find your local food bank by entering your zip code and state at this webpage.
Find school meals near you using this interactive map
Find locations with no-cost meals for children in Houston
Questions to Ask\nWhen Visiting a School
Want to Know the Quality of Schools Near You? Use this tool to search and compare Texas schools.
A list of questions for parents to ask while visiting schools.
Quality school practices that can be adopted by campuses and that parents can advocate for.
This checklist helps parents track actions to support children throughout their education by grade.
This guide provides tips and actions parents can take to support their child’s academic success.
Keeping kids safe from fires: materials to learn more about discussing fire safety with children.
Some good rules of thumb for parents to ensure their children’s safety online.
Water safety resources for families and children.
Find a child care center or home near you.
Local CCR&Rs can help families find child care options near their home or work.
This portal help frontline essential workers find available child care near their home or work.
View this map to explore child care deserts and the access landscape across the state of Texas.
This checklist will help you recognize quality and make informed decisions when choosing child care.
In a life threatening emergency, call 911.
Contact information listed belong to not-for-profit organizations and are not government agencies or government affiliated.
Type your notes here! Don\'t forget to save.
